skill.name: statistical-analysis
skill.description: Statistical analysis toolkit. Hypothesis tests (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square), regression, correlation, Bayesian stats, power analysis, assumption checks, APA reporting, for academic research.
skill.summary: Statistical analysis toolkit. Hypothesis tests (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square), regression, correlation,...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found. Files are documentation and a local analysis helper script without network or system access.

content.value_statement: Selecting the right test and reporting results can be confusing. This skill guides test choice, assumption checks, effect sizes, and APA reporting.
actual_capabilities: Select tests for group comparisons and relationships using a decision guide
Check normality with Shapiro-Wilk tests and Q-Q plots
Check homogeneity of variance with Levene test and variance plots
Detect outliers using IQR or z-score methods with visual highlights
Run a comprehensive assumption check with recommendations
Provide APA reporting templates and effect size guidance
limitations: Does not execute full statistical analyses automatically
Requires Python libraries like numpy, pandas, scipy, matplotlib, and seaborn
Does not handle data loading or cleaning steps
Bayes Factor calculation examples are limited

use_cases.title: Plan a thesis analysis
use_cases.description: Choose tests, check assumptions, and plan power analysis for a study design.

use_cases.title: Validate model assumptions
use_cases.description: Run normality, variance, linearity, and outlier checks before modeling.

use_cases.title: Write APA results
use_cases.description: Generate reporting templates with effect sizes and assumption summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Pick a test
prompt_templates.prompt: I have two independent groups with a continuous outcome. The data look non-normal. Which test should I use and why?

prompt_templates.title: Check assumptions
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through assumption checks for a one-way ANOVA and suggest remedies if assumptions fail.

prompt_templates.title: Report results
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an APA style reporting template for a multiple regression with three predictors.

prompt_templates.title: Bayesian plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a Bayesian t-test workflow with priors, diagnostics, and reporting guidance.

output_examples.input: Compare two groups and explain the assumptions I must check
output: Select an independent samples t-test for normal data, or Mann-Whitney U for non-normal data
Check normality with Shapiro-Wilk and Q-Q plots for each group
Check homogeneity with Levene test and compare variance ratios
If violations occur, use Welch correction or non-parametric alternatives

best_practices: Check assumptions before interpreting results and report the checks
Report effect sizes with confidence intervals for all analyses
Plan sample size with a priori power analysis
anti_patterns: Choosing tests based only on p-values without assumptions
Reporting only significant results and omitting effect sizes
Using post hoc power as proof of validity

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works as guidance in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and example code, not automated data analysis.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my Python stack?
faq.answer: Yes, it references numpy, pandas, scipy, statsmodels, and pingouin.

faq.question: Does it access or upload my data?
faq.answer: No, it contains local guidance and scripts without network actions.

faq.question: What if plots or tests fail?
faq.answer: Verify required libraries, data types, and missing values before rerunning.

faq.question: How does it compare to a stats package?
faq.answer: It guides selection and reporting but does not replace statistical software.
